path: ./Audit_Reports_2024/Coinfabrik/Money on Chain Security Audit III - CoinFabrik Blog.pdf

findings.title: Misuse of the different call methods: call.value(), send() and transfer()
findings.description: The audit report highlights the misuse of different call methods, specifically call.value(), send(), and transfer(). This can lead to unintended behavior or security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Integer rounding errors, overflow, underflow and related usage of SafeMath functions
findings.description: Potential issues with integer operations leading to rounding errors, overflows, or underflows, potentially mitigated by using SafeMath functions.

findings.title: Old compiler version pragmas
findings.description: The contracts require solidity version 0.4.24 which was released on May 2018 and it is recommended to upgrade to a more recent version as many issues and ambiguities get fixed in each release.

findings.title: Race conditions such as reentrancy attacks or front running
findings.description: The contract is vulnerable to race conditions, including reentrancy attacks and front running.

findings.title: Misuse of block timestamps, assuming anything other than them being strictly increasing
findings.description: The contract assumes block timestamps to be strictly increasing, which is not always true and can lead to potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Potential gas cost of functions being over the gas limit
findings.description: The potential gas cost of functions may exceed the gas limit.

findings.title: Missing function qualifiers and their misuse
findings.description: The audit report highlights the potential misuse of functions without proper qualifiers.

findings.title: Code and Contract Interaction Complexity
findings.description: The audit report highlights complexity issues with code and contract interactions.

findings.title: Wrong or missing error handling
findings.description: The audit report highlights the importance of proper error handling in smart contracts.

findings.title: Potential overuse of transfers in a transaction might produce unnecessary fees
findings.description: Withdrawal pattern should be used instead to avoid producing unnecessary fees.

findings.title: Insufficient analysis of the function input requirements
findings.description: The audit report highlights the importance of thoroughly analyzing function input requirements to prevent potential security vulnerabilities.

findings.title: Unhelpful variables names
findings.description: There are a few instances in the Oracle contracts where variables and parameters have names that are not helpful to understand the code.
